lines: ﻿Soon a farmer, his wife and their young son arrived. They were tired and sat down in Mango's shade. "God planted this tree just for us. If it hadn't been here we'd have nowhere to rest," said the farmer.
His wife glanced up. "Look! Mangoes!" she said. "Let's knock them down with stones."
"I am hungry. Pluck some for me," their son pleaded.

Mango feared trouble. He was about to take to his heels but was reassured by the farmer's words, "I won't do anything wrong. The tree doesn't belong to us. I won't rob it of its fruit." Immediately Mango let fall half a dozen ripe mangoes.
"God be blessed! He is pleased with us! He has given us mangoes. We can eat them, can't we?" asked his wife.
"Yes. They came down by the grace of God." Mango smiled to himself.
The farmer said, "On our way home we'll sow the mango-stones by the roadside. Then more trees will sprout and grow."
Mango was very pleased. He had reaped the reward of his generosity.
After he had had his share, the boy looked up and said, "Father, the tree is still laden with fruit."
His wife interrupted, "We'll eat them on the way."
The farmer said, "Don't be greedy, Laxmi. Other hungry and tired travellers may pass this way. Leave the mangoes for them. It was the thoughtfulness of others that enabled us to fill our stomachs."
